thread.title: How to Make a Small DIY Home Photography Studio
thread.title_full: How to Make a Small DIY Home Photography Studio

author: Andy Orin
title: How to Make a Small DIY Home Photography Studio
text:
If you’re looking to take slick photos of small items, whether they’re toys, product shots, or things you’re looking to sell online, it’s pretty easy to make a little photography studio using nothing but household items. Advertisement 
This video from COOPH shows what you need to make your little photography studio for small, medium, and large objects. Like any photography it really comes down to controlling the lighting and the backdrop at different scales. At the small end you can make a simple light diffuser with baking paper and simply curl a large piece of paper for a seamless background. You can scale the same basic concept up with larger rolls of paper, and aluminum foil can act as a light reflector in a pinch. 
Going a bit larger, you might want to make a rudimentary flash diffusers with any thin semi-opaque plastic container fixed on your camera’s flash. Watch the video for more ways you can use household objects to improvise a photography studio of your own. Advertisement
